title: Byron Township, Buchanan County, Iowa
text:
Byron Township is one of sixteen <a href="Township%20%28United%20States%29">townships</a> in <a href="Buchanan%20County%2C%20Iowa">Buchanan County</a>, <a href="Iowa">Iowa</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. As of the <a href="United%20States%20Census%2C%202000">2000 census</a>, its population was 1,063. Byron Township was organized in 1856.
Geography.
Byron Township covers an area of and contains one incorporated settlement, <a href="Winthrop%2C%20Iowa">Winthrop</a>. According to the <a href="United%20States%20Geological%20Survey">USGS</a>, it contains three cemeteries: Byron, Fairview and Payne. The former townsite of <a href="Doris%2C%20Iowa">Doris</a> also lies in the township.
